Description: Limestone ostracon, with remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink on one side and remains of two lines on the other side containing a letter, text smudged in places.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.49, pl.38)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.103)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (88361) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/88361)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 38:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 155 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
